edu.jsu.mcis

Class ArgumentParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.jsu.mcis.ArgumentParser

  • public class ArgumentParser
extends Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ArgumentParser(String programName)
      Creates a LinkedHashMap for PositionalArguments & NamedArguments while setting the current positional argument count to 0.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addNamedArgument(String name, Argument.Type dataType)
      Adds a named argument in its corresponding HashMap.
      void addPositionalArgument(String name, Argument.Type dataType)
      Adds a positional argument to the HashMap based on the String name and Argument type.
      String getArgumentDescription(String name)
      Returns the argument description by searching the NamedArgument HashMap.
      String getArgumentNames()
      Searches through both the NamedArguments & PositionalArguments by iterating over the HashMaps.
      Argument.Type getArgumentType(String name)
      Returns the enumerated value based on whether the name is contained in the NamedArgument HashMap.
      <T> T getArgumentValue(String name)
      Returns the argument value based on the name in either the NamedArgument or PositionalArgument HashMap.
      String getHelpString()
      Returns the current help information.
      String getNamedArgumentAlternateName(String name)
      Returns the current alternate name argument from the HashMap.
      <T> T getNamedArgumentDefaultValue(String name)
      Returns the current named arguments default value based on whether the String is " " or contains information.
      boolean getNamedArgumentRequired(String name)
      Returns the named arguments required attribute based on whether the String is " " or contains information.
      int getPositionalArgumentSize()
      Return the current size of the PositionalArguments HashMap.
      int getPositionId(String name)
      Returns the position ID based on the arguments name in the HashMap.
      String getProgramDescription()
      Returns the current program description.
      String getProgramName()
      Returns the current program name.
      void parse(String argumentsToParse)
      Formats the parsed information by setting the String appropriately.
      void parse(String[] argumentsToParse)
      Creates a blank String in order to parse the data appropriately.
      void setArgumentDescription(String name, String description)
      Sets a description to the current holder if the argument name is equal to " ".Otherwise it will set the description in the NamedArgument HashMap if the name matches the key.
      void setNamedArgumentAlternateName(String name, String alternateName)
      Sets an alternate name that can be used for named arguments that can be accessed from the HashMap.
      void setNamedArgumentDefaultValue(String name, Object defaultValue)
      Sets a default value for named arguments based on whether the String is " " or contains information.
      void setNamedArgumentRequired(String name)
      Sets the named arguments required field based on whether the String is " " or contains information.
      void setProgramDescription(String programDescription)
      Sets the programs description.

      • setArgumentDescription

        public void setArgumentDescription(String name,
                          String description)

        description - Uses the description field.

      • getArgumentDescription

        public String getArgumentDescription(String name)
        Returns the argument description by searching the NamedArgument HashMap. If the name parameter is " ", then it will return the current description holder.
        Parameters:
        name - Uses the name field.
        Returns:
        Gives the description of the argument.

      • getArgumentType

        Returns:
